The p-V diagram shows three states: State A: p = 3 × 10³ Pa, V = 1 × 10⁻³ m³; State B: p = 2 × 10³ Pa, V = 2 × 10⁻³ m³; State C: p = 2 × 10³ Pa, V = 3 × 10⁻³ m³.
For an ideal gas: PV = nRT (where n is constant). Since the mass is constant, the number of moles (n) is constant. Therefore, we can use the relationship: PV/T = constant = nR.
